zone.line: Its wheels are solid clouds, azure & gold,
Such as the genii of the thunderstorm
Pile on the floor of the illumined sea
When the Sun rushes under it, they roll
And move & grow as with an inward wind.
Within it sits a winged Infant, br white
Its countenance like the whiteness of bright
as snow,
Its plumes are like feathers of sunny frost,
Its limbs gleam white, thro the wind-flowing
folds
Of its white robe, woof of Ã¦therial pearl--
Its hair is white,--the brightness of white light
Scattered in strings, yet its two eyes are
Heavens
Of liquid darkness, which the Deity
Within, seems pouring, as a storm is poured
From jagged clouds, out of their arrowy lashes
Tempering the cold & radiant air around
With fire which is not brightness, in its hand
It sways a quivering moonbeam, from
whose point
A guiding power directs the chariots prow
Over its wheeled clouds, which as they roll
Over the bending grass & flowers & waves, wake
sounds
Sweet as a singing rain of silver dew.
